item.title: Need Help Fast
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

[quote=“ipkudown, post:13, topic:362260”][quote author=runefreak10 link=topic=458546.msg3355982#msg3355982 date=1285875236]

[code=java] if(NPCID == 1001)
{
if (q3 != 15)
{
sM(“You must complete Desert Treasure in order to use ancient magics.”);
return;
}
if (playerAncientMagics == 1)
{
setSidebarInterface(6, 1151);
playerAncientMagics = 0;
sM(“You convert into normal magics.”);
}
else if (playerAncientMagics == 0)
{
setSidebarInterface(6, 12855);
playerAncientMagics = 1;
sM(“You convert into ancient magics.”);
}
}

Add that under case 155: which involves the first click option on npcs.
[/quote]

found it and it won’t work[/code][/quote]
[/quote]
You’re not adding it right then. Is it telling you anything in the game? Are you using it for the npc 1001? Did it compile?

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help Fast
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

if(NPCID == 1001) { if (q3 != 15) { sM("You must complete Desert Treasure in order to use ancient magics."); return; } if (playerAncientMagics == 1) { setSidebarInterface(6, 1151); playerAncientMagics = 0; sM("You convert into normal magics."); } else if (playerAncientMagics == 0) { setSidebarInterface(6, 12855); playerAncientMagics = 1; sM("You convert into ancient magics."); } }

Add that under case 155: which involves the first click option on npcs.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help Fast
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

[quote=“ipkudown, post:8, topic:362260”][quote author=usman555 link=topic=458546.msg3355430#msg3355430 date=1285789447]
I’ll explain
in yuor code here, it says

playerAncientMagics = 0;

Meaning that you declared “playerAncientMagics” as an integer. And whenever you switch to ancients, it turns to one. And when you switch to normal book, it turns to 0. What Steve is saying that its less confusing if you make it a boolean and declare it like this

public boolean playerAncientMagics = false;

And you can change it to “true” instead of “1”. Because you might get confused which is which. You might think that
0 = ancients
1 = normal

when its actually

0 = normal
1 = ancients
[/quote]

oh really this time i dont get it

what you mean ?[/quote]Learn Java.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help Fast
item.dc:creator: @ipkudown ipkudown
item.description:
@ipkudown wrote:

[quote=“usman555, post:7, topic:362260”] I’ll explain
in yuor code here, it says

playerAncientMagics = 0;

Meaning that you declared “playerAncientMagics” as an integer. And whenever you switch to ancients, it turns to one. And when you switch to normal book, it turns to 0. What Steve is saying that its less confusing if you make it a boolean and declare it like this

public boolean playerAncientMagics = false;

And you can change it to “true” instead of “1”. Because you might get confused which is which. You might think that
0 = ancients
1 = normal

when its actually

0 = normal
1 = ancients[/quote]

oh really this time i dont get it

what you mean ?

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help Fast
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

I’ll explain
in yuor code here, it says

playerAncientMagics = 0;

Meaning that you declared “playerAncientMagics” as an integer. And whenever you switch to ancients, it turns to one. And when you switch to normal book, it turns to 0. What Steve is saying that its less confusing if you make it a boolean and declare it like this

public boolean playerAncientMagics = false;

And you can change it to “true” instead of “1”. Because you might get confused which is which. You might think that
0 = ancients
1 = normal

when its actually

0 = normal
1 = ancients

Read full topic

item.description:

i have this code

if(NPCID == 1001){ if (q3 != 15 && playerAncientMagics == 0){ sM("You must complete Desert Treasure if you want to use Ancients."); } if (playerAncientMagics == 1) { setSidebarInterface(6, 1151); // magic tab (ancient = 12855); // /normal = 1151 playerAncientMagics = 0; sM("You convert to normal magic!"); } else if (playerAncientMagics == 0 && q3 == 15) { setSidebarInterface(6, 12855); // magic tab (ancient = 12855); playerAncientMagics = 1; sM("You convert to ancient magicks!"); } }
